Sentencas: Chromium (Cr) evaporation of ferritic stainless steel (FSS) interconnects is considered to be the main reason for severe deterioration of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Impact of Different Atmospheres on Oxidation and Electrical Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Interconnect with Co-Containing Protective Coating

Sentencas: To suppress the influence of Cr evaporation, the development of a protective coating material on the FSS interconnects has been proved to be an effective way.
Titulo: Impact of Different Atmospheres on Oxidation and Electrical Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Interconnect with Co-Containing Protective Coating

Sentencas: Herein, we prepare a Co-containing protective coating via a facile pack cementation technique in different atmospheres on an AISI 430 FSS interconnect.
Titulo: Impact of Different Atmospheres on Oxidation and Electrical Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Interconnect with Co-Containing Protective Coating

Sentencas: The obtained coating is valid for enhancing the oxidation resistance and electrical performance of the FSS interconnect.
Titulo: Impact of Different Atmospheres on Oxidation and Electrical Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Interconnect with Co-Containing Protective Coating

Sentencas: After the isothermal oxidation test, the weight gain of the coated sample in Ar (0.415 mg/cm(2)) is smaller than that of uncoated (1.613 mg/cm(2)) and coated samples in air (0.498 mg/cm(2)).
Titulo: Impact of Different Atmospheres on Oxidation and Electrical Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Interconnect with Co-Containing Protective Coating

Sentencas: In addition, after the area specific resistance (ASR) test, the coated sample (73.68 m Omega( )cm(2)) in Ar has the lowest ASR compared with the uncoated (236.88 m Omega cm(2)) and coated samples in air (96.32 m Omega cm(2)).
Titulo: Impact of Different Atmospheres on Oxidation and Electrical Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Interconnect with Co-Containing Protective Coating

Sentencas: These results indicate that the formation of the CoFe2O4 spinel layer heightens oxidation resistance and electrical properties through preventing the outward diffusion of Cr3+ and inward diffusion of O2-.
Titulo: Impact of Different Atmospheres on Oxidation and Electrical Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Interconnect with Co-Containing Protective Coating

Sentencas: This work verifies that the Co-containing protective coating prepared in Ar is a promising coating material for SOFC applications.
Titulo: Impact of Different Atmospheres on Oxidation and Electrical Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Interconnect with Co-Containing Protective Coating
